segments.text: There are so many people that the tickets are all sold out !
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Luckily we got the last two .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Look , Danny . The Four Great Inventions !
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Gunpowder , compass , the paper making , and the printing .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I really admire those who made such great inventions !
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: May , I don't see why they are great . They are just simple things .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: They look simple today . But they were milestones in their times .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Milestones ? May , you must be kidding .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Just think Bill Gates , those inventions are as important as the windows system .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Well , I suppose the ancient inventors made a lot of money out of them .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Why ? Didn't you say that they were milestones ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Yes , but they went to the public without any patent protection .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Well , their inventors were not as clever as Bill Gates .
segments.speaker: S2
